quest.name: An Ending to Mark a New Beginning
journal: Alphinaud seems to be at a loss for words.

Alphinaud recalls that the Ishgardian crystals are still somewhere within Zahar'ak, prompting Thancred to interject that he will see to their recovery─alone. Unable to persuade the bard to accept assistance, Alphinaud resolves to go and find Yda and Papalymo, leaving you with a tired Alisaie and a morose Urianger, who are doing their best not to speak to each other.

You finally break the silence, giving the others an excuse to speak. Alisaie declares that she wanted to believe Urianger would never betray them, but that some small part of her feared the worst. In response, the Archon once more expresses sorrow for his deception, though it is plain that he still believes the ends justified the means. Alisaie, however, cannot bring herself to condone his actions. Even so, she allows him to escort her to safety, suggesting that any rift that may have grown between them is already on its way to mending.

Having returned to Little Ala Mhigo, you and Alphinaud meet with Yda and Papalymo, who are understandably dumbstruck to hear the tale of your visit to the aetherial sea. After a pause, Papalymo declares that it is past time he and Yda rejoined the Scions. A statement of the glaringly obvious, no doubt, but a welcome one nonetheless. As you all prepare to return to the Rising Stones, you are accosted by Gundobald, who is apparently acquainted with both Yda and her father, with whom he fought in the revolution against the King of Ruin twenty years ago. He goes on to recall how Yda once played an active role in the Resistance...until she vanished one day, leaving him fearing the worst. Though plainly startled, Yda musters an apology, explaining that her involvement with the Circle of Knowing and its successor, the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, necessitated absolute secrecy. Suddenly conscious that her friends are waiting for her at the Rising Stones, she runs off, leaving Papalymo to reassure Gundobald that they will both return ere long.

With every surviving senior Scion now safely back at the Rising Stones, Alphinaud takes the opportunity to propose that the structure of the organization be revised. Rather than being beholden to a strict hierarchy, he believes that each member should be allowed to pursue whatever activities they think would best serve to ensure the safety and security of the realm. The others are amenable to this idea in principle─though, in practice, all seem content to carry on with their current activities. With thoughts now turning to the future, Krile and Alisaie are welcomed as a fully fledged Scions, though the latter accepts the honor with rather less enthusiasm than the former. Still more negative is Urianger, who is plainly haunted by feelings of guilt over his role in Minfilia's fate─but after some urging from Thancred, he too agrees to resume his research, thus completing the party─save, of course, for one. Expectantly, your friends and colleagues turn to you, eager to hear what you intend, and after looking deep within your heart, you know the answer.

The people you have met. The moments you have shared. The losses you have suffered. The tragedies you have overcome. All of it has made you and the Scions of the Seventh Dawn who you are today. Where you go from here and what the future holds, only the Twelve know...but Alphinaud knows that you will find out together.
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud in the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...We should talk about what to do next.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...Speak thy mind. I do not expect thy forgiveness.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Forgive me. My thoughts were elsewhere. And this when I know full well there is yet work to be done. The crystals─

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Leave them to me. I will go back into Zahar'ak and secure them.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The Amalj'aa will still be in disarray after the thrashing the Warriors of Darkness gave them. They are not like to notice a lone bard skulking about.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But Thancred, you─

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Don't have to do this, I know. But I want to. I will see you at the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...I should go and find Yda and Papalymo. They must have finished searching the Masks' camp by now. Not that it matters anymore...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You must be tired, Forename. I know I am...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If thou wilt permit me, my lady, I would ask a question. When didst thou become aware of mine independent pursuits?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: When I saw you meeting with that Warrior of Darkness and the Ascian in white at the Great Library.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I tried not to think the worst. You've never been one to confide in others, so I knew that even were your intentions pure, you would not share your plans with us until you felt the time was right.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But I cannot deny that a part of me feared you had simply betrayed us.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Would that there had been another way. Know that I took no pleasure in deceiving thee, and that these sins will forever weigh heavy on my heart.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...I understand why you did what you did. That you but sought to achieve the greatest good while inflicting the least harm. Not many would have the courage to make that choice.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But even knowing what came of your actions...I find that I cannot condone them. I'm sorry.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Forename, forgive me, but I believe the events of the day have taken their toll on me. I should like to rest for a while.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text:
If thou wilt grant me leave, I would gladly escort thee unto a refuge of thine own choosing.
Once my lady hath regained her strength, we shall join thee at the Rising Stones. Until then, Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (I have yet to tell them what happened in Zahar'ak. I thought it best to do so together.)

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are! We've finished our search, in case you were wondering.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename. Alphinaud said you would be joining us.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem the Griffin's double was telling the truth, insofar as we found nothing resembling a sizable cache of crystals in the Masks' camp. Did you perchance find one in Zahar'ak?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Actually...

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: ...I don't believe it. The crystals, Minfilia, all of it. It's just─ I don't know what it is.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I sympathize, Yda. Even now, I struggle to comprehend that which I saw... The only thing I can say with any certainty is that I feel blessed to have been granted a final chance to speak with her. 'Twas bittersweet, aye, but also...affirming.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: ...Alphinaud, I believe it is past time Yda and I rejoined the Scions. We have been away for far too long.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Though I am loath to leave the Griffin to his own devices, I feel our investigation would benefit from your more dispassionate perspectives. And I hope that we might, in turn, offer our own opinions on the many challenges that you have faced in our absence.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Gods, it's been absolutely ages, hasn't it? I can't wait to hear about everyone's adventures.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We should be glad to recount them. And Tataru's tales may well surprise you.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Yda...? Yda! Rhalgr be praised, it is you!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Yda, alive and standing here before me, in the flesh! I can hardly believe my eyes!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Oh, come now, has it really been so long you don't remember me? It's Gundobald! I fought beside your father in the revolution!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Do not think less of her, friends! It's been twenty years since the occupation sent us our separate ways. But the Resistance were always welcome in Little Ala Mhigo. They gave us hope─and young Yda most of all!

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Aye, Yda here was always full of fire, ever the first to volunteer for a mission. Until the day she up and vanished, that is! There were rumors, and we feared the worst, but here you are, alive and well, looking nary a day older!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: W-Well, what can I say? I...I'm sorry for running off like that and making you all worry.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: It's a long story, but, you see, I...I got involved with my friends here, the Scions─ Oh, sorry, we were still the Circle of Knowing back then, right! A-Anyway, I wanted to come back and tell you, but it was all very secretive stuff at the time and, uh...as you can see, I'm completely fine!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: I know we've got a lot to talk about─and we will─but right now I've got to hurry back to our headquarters. My friends are expecting me!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Pray forgive her. It has been a very long day for us all. I promise we will visit again at the first opportunity.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Let us return to the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Hells take me for giving you that mask...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Yda's father was one of the finest men I've ever known. A true leader of the revolution. He inspired countless others to rise up and cast down the tyrant Theodoric, and fought tirelessly for the land he loved.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: ...But not even he could inspire us to victory over the Garleans. He died...and I grew old. But Yda carried on his legacy─our legacy...

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: Huzzah! Have you heard, Forename!? Yda and Papalymo are returned!

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: We have not had a chance to speak, but the mere sight of them was enough to raise our spirits! Huzzah!

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: Many of our number are still out in the field, but I believe Ocher's party should be returning shortly.

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: ...You needn't say a word, Forename. I know. I know...

dialogue.name: FLHAMINN
dialogue.text: Wherever she wanders, no matter how far, she will always be with us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Welcome home, Forename. I trust your journey was uneventful. You will be pleased to hear that Thancred has secured the crystals. He sent word a short while ago.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Once he has delivered them safely into the Temple Knights' care, he will rejoin us here, and we can declare this matter officially resolved.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: While awaiting your arrival, I took the opportunity to contact Y'shtola and Krile, and briefed them on all that has occurred. I also requested that they return to the Rising Stones at their earliest convenience. Now that our lost friends have been found, it would seem meet to discuss the future.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Leave it to me, Forename! I'll make sure she's properly introduced to everyone!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> It's official, then. Gods, I hope I don't regret this.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Same as it ever was...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: As agreed, we shall spend the coming moons conducting our own independent research. Should you have need of our services, however, you are of course welcome to seek us out.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: It would seem that I'm a Scion, then. Hmm... Some derive comfort from such titles, but I cannot say that I feel any different from before. Well, mayhap a twinge of pride...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: It may be argued that the great sundering of the Source was an aberration, and the existence of the ten and three reflections an offense to the natural order.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: That, most assuredly, is the Ascians' belief. 'Twas in the hope of opening mine eyes to said revelation that they first came unto me, imagining it sufficient to secure mine allegiance.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Nor would they have been mistaken─were my heart a temple to truth alone. But as a devoted follower of Master Louisoix's teachings, and for the love I bear him and his, I hearkened not to their words.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: I suppose I should not be surprised. With everyone standing in a circle delivering grand proclamations about their future endeavors, she naturally felt obliged to make up one of her own.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I have Ser Aymeric's assurances that the Temple Knights will henceforth keep a close eye on the Ishgardian crystal trade.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Oh, and he extends his deepest apologies for your dinner having been cut short. Courteous fellow, isn't he? You would never guess he was a politician.

dialogue.name: HOARYBOULDER
dialogue.text: Ohoho! Do not think I will be bested so easily again! When my competition with Lady Yda has ended, the Scions of the Seventh Dawn shall crown a new champion of the squat!

dialogue.name: COULTENET
dialogue.text: 'Tis passing strange to think that we may never see Lady Minfilia again. After witnessing so many of our missing comrades return to us, I dared to hope that she might one day do the same...

dialogue.name: OCHERBOULDER
dialogue.text: All these little mistakes are beginning to add up, Aenor! You must try harder to remain focused!

dialogue.name: AENOR
dialogue.text: I-I'm doing my best, Ocher, I am! I just can't seem to clear my mind. I keep thinking about you...and your brother...and me...

dialogue.name: CLEMENCE
dialogue.text: (Trouble in paradise, eh? Heh heh heh...)

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Look at them, Forename. The Scions of the Seventh Dawn. Look how far we've come...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The people we've met. The moments we've shared. The losses we've suffered. The tragedies we've overcome. All of it has made us who we are today.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Where we go from here and what the future holds, only the Twelve know...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...But I know that we will find out together.

dialogue.name: IRONMASK02350
dialogue.text: Well done, brother. You may resume your normal duties and rejoin the others. The coming battle shall be our greatest yet, and I intend to stand with you all on that glorious day.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: ...True believers are so readily led.

dialogue.name: IRONMASK02350
dialogue.text: I have given them everything they desired. All for which they have prayed. I doubt you can say the same for your pawns.

dialogue.name: IRONMASK02350
dialogue.text: Get what you wanted, then? Was it all worth it in the end?

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: There were some...unexpected developments, but they were ultimately to our advantage.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text:
Be it host to a surfeit of Light or Dark, a world bereft of equilibrium is but a void in waiting. And a void is of no use to my master.
I shall follow Her emissary with great interest.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: As for the “pawns” whom you so pity...they have delivered unto me a gift, which I do now present to you.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: The eyes of Nidhogg. Many were the candidates considered, but by your deeds, you have proven yourself the most deserving.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUSEORZEA
dialogue.text: A man of boundless rage and bottomless despair, in whose breast beats a heart which thirsts for vengeance. Only you are fit to wield these eyes─for weal or for woe.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: (-???-)Hmph. So it was here all along...

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Oh, just you wait, my pretty! You and I are going to have so much fun!
